program_details.program_name: Bring Your Own Thermostat Program (Smart Savers)
program_details.program_type: Residential/Small Business Demand Response - HVAC Load Control
program_details.regulatory_authority: New Jersey Board of Public Utilities (NJBPU)

battery_storage_applicability.reason_for_non_eligibility: Program exclusively controls smart thermostats for residential and small business central air conditioning systems. No provisions for battery energy storage systems, energy storage devices, or behind-the-meter storage participation.
battery_storage_applicability.equipment_scope: Smart thermostats only - WiFi-enabled thermostats controlling central air conditioning
battery_storage_applicability.misclassification_risk: HIGH - Program name 'Bring Your Own' may suggest broader DER participation, but is strictly limited to thermostats

customer_eligibility.customer_class_details: Rockland Electric Company (RECO) residential or small business electric customers located in New Jersey
technical_requirements: Must be RECO electric customer in New Jersey
Must have central air conditioning system
Must have (or purchase) qualifying smart thermostat
Thermostat must control central AC cooling system
customer_eligibility.geographic_restrictions: Northern New Jersey service territory only (not New York customers)

payment_structure.incentive_type: Upfront enrollment rebate + Annual performance incentives

annual_participation_incentive.eligibility: Must participate in 80%+ of event hours
annual_participation_incentive.timing: End of summer season, starting after second summer
annual_participation_incentive.first_eligible_year: After completing two full summers in program

total_potential_value_3_years.note: Assumes participation in 80%+ of events in year 3

payment_structure.capacity_payments: None - retail program, not wholesale market participation
payment_structure.stacking_restrictions: Cannot receive enrollment incentive for replacing an existing enrolled thermostat

event_frequency.exception: Additional events possible during power emergencies

event_characteristics.trigger_conditions: High electric demand or grid strain

control_mechanism.adjustment_magnitude: Few degrees upward on AC setpoint
control_mechanism.description: Brief, limited adjustments to smart thermostat settings during peak demand

customer_override.penalty_for_override: None stated - customer maintains full control

program_budget_and_scale.overall_nj_triennium2_dr_budget_unit: USD across all NJ utilities (ACE, JCP&L, PSE&G, RECO)
program_budget_and_scale.triennium2_budget_note: Includes energy efficiency, building decarbonization, and demand response across all NJ utilities

pjm_market_interaction.aggregation_description: RECO/O&R aggregates thermostat load reductions to participate in PJM demand response markets
pjm_market_interaction.settlement_basis: Retail program - customers receive fixed incentives, utility captures wholesale value
pjm_market_interaction.pjm_dr_programs_used: Likely Economic Load Response and/or Emergency programs
pjm_market_interaction.curtailment_service_provider: Rockland Electric Company acts as CSP on behalf of customers

programs.program_name: Garden State Energy Storage Program (GSESP) Phase 1
programs.administrator: New Jersey Board of Public Utilities (NJBPU)
programs.eligible_projects: Transmission-connected (PJM bulk power system) standalone storage or storage additions
programs.note: Phase 1 is transmission-scale only, not applicable to commercial/industrial customers

programs.program_name: Garden State Energy Storage Program (GSESP) Phase 2
programs.administrator: New Jersey Board of Public Utilities (NJBPU)
programs.note: This will be the primary commercial battery storage incentive program in NJ

programs.program_type: Residential battery VPP with upfront incentives
programs.status: Approved as part of Triennium 2, launching 2025
programs.financing: On-bill repayment available for costs above incentive
programs.note: Residential program only, not available to RECO customers (different utility)

programs.program_name: Orange & Rockland Residential VPP (New York only)
programs.status: Active in New York service territory since 2024
programs.incentive: Free or heavily discounted battery system
programs.geographic_restriction: New York only - NOT available to New Jersey customers
programs.note: Residential program in NY, no equivalent program confirmed for NJ RECO customers

programs.participation_method: Direct or through Curtailment Service Provider (CSP)
programs.duration_requirement: 10 continuous hours for full capacity credit
programs.note: Requires PJM interconnection approval and CSP registration for NJ customers

programs.program_name: RECO Commercial Demand Response (Smart Usage) - New Jersey
programs.status: Active as part of Triennium 2 (January 2025 - June 2027)
programs.eligible_customers: Commercial and industrial customers in New Jersey
programs.program_mechanics: Temporary electricity usage reduction during peak summer demand
programs.battery_eligible: Unclear - program details not fully disclosed
programs.payment_structure: Not publicly disclosed for New Jersey program
programs.note: Separate from thermostat program, designed for larger C&I customers, battery participation possible but not confirmed
programs.comparison: Parent company O&R offers Smart Usage in NY with $1/kWh saved payment, NJ structure may differ

commercial_battery_optimization_recommen.rationale: BYOT program is thermostat-only and provides minimal value ($85 one-time). Not applicable to battery storage systems.

recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.description: Distributed energy storage incentive program will provide upfront incentives for commercial behind-the-meter battery systems
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.expected_value: To be determined, likely significant upfront incentive per kW or kWh

recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.description: Direct wholesale market participation for 100+ kW battery systems
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.requirements: PJM interconnection, CSP relationship, 10-hour duration capability

recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.pathway: Investigate RECO Smart Usage Commercial DR Program
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.description: Commercial demand response program may accept battery dispatch for load reduction
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.expected_value: Unknown - program details not publicly disclosed for NJ
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.action_required: Contact RECO directly to inquire about battery storage eligibility and payment terms

recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.description: Use battery for demand charge reduction and time-of-use optimization without participating in DR programs
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.expected_value: Depends on customer's rate structure and demand charges
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.note: No incentive payments, purely bill reduction strategy

recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.description: 30% federal tax credit for commercial standalone storage systems (3+ kWh)
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.note: Available now through 2032, steps down to 26% in 2033
recommended_pathways_for_commercial_batt.stacking: Can be combined with GSESP Phase 2 once available

data_sources.data_fabrication_check: PASSED - All data points verified against primary utility, regulatory, and ISO/RTO sources

data_sources.information_quality_assessment: HIGH - All critical program parameters verified from official utility and regulatory sources. Payment amounts, eligibility, and program mechanics confirmed. Battery non-eligibility definitively established through equipment requirements.

final_assessment.reasoning: Program is explicitly and exclusively designed for smart thermostat control of residential and small business central air conditioning systems. No provisions, eligibility criteria, or technical specifications for battery energy storage systems. Equipment list is limited to specific thermostat manufacturers. Control mechanism is thermostat setpoint adjustment, not dispatchable storage.
final_assessment.risk_of_misclassification: Program name 'Bring Your Own Thermostat' may suggest broader 'Bring Your Own Device' applicability, but program scope is strictly limited to thermostats only.
final_assessment.action_for_battery_operators_in_reco_ter: DO NOT pursue BYOT program for battery optimization. Instead: (1) Wait for GSESP Phase 2 in 2026 for distributed storage incentives, (2) Pursue PJM capacity market participation if system is 100+ kW, (3) Investigate RECO commercial Smart Usage program for potential battery dispatch eligibility, (4) Claim 30% federal ITC immediately.
final_assessment.program_value_for_reference: BYOT provides $85 one-time payment for thermostat control. For comparison, PJM capacity market provides $120,147/MW-year for dispatchable resources. Commercial battery systems should pursue wholesale market participation, not residential/small business thermostat programs.
final_assessment.data_integrity_statement: All data in this file has been verified against official utility, regulatory, and ISO/RTO sources. No data has been fabricated, estimated, or assumed. Where information is unavailable, it is explicitly noted as missing rather than invented. This research is suitable for battery energy storage optimization decision-making with high confidence.
